titlestmt.subtitle: Collection of Streetfare Journal poetry posters, 1984-1997, at the Lilly Library, Indiana University
titlestmt.author: Ava Dickerson

profiledesc.creation: This finding aid was produced using ArchivesSpace on 2024-02-18 22:33:50 -0500.
profiledesc.langusage: Description is written in: English, Latin script.

did.abstract: The Streetfare Journal poetry posters consist of a collection of all 102 full color interior bus posters featuring poetry and visual art for display on urban bus systems throughout the U.S.

accessrestrict.head: Conditions Governing Access
accessrestrict.p: This collection is open for research.
Many collections are housed offsite; retrieval requires advance notice. Please make an appointment a minimum of one week in advance of your visit.

userestrict.head: Conditions Governing Use
userestrict.p: Photography and digitization may be restricted for some collections. Copyright restrictions may apply. Before publishing, researchers are responsible for securing permission from all applicable rights holders, then filling out the Permission to Publish form.

bioghist.head: Historical Note
bioghist.p: The Streetfare Journal poetry series was sponsored by TDI (Transportation Displays Incorporated) and grants from the Lannan Foundation (Los Angeles), the National Endowment for the Arts (Washington, D.C.), the Lila Wallace-Reader's Digest Fund (New York), (internationally) the Australia Council for the Arts, and other agencies.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: The collection consists of 102 full color interior bus posters featuring poetry and visual art for display on urban bus systems throughout the U.S. The broadsides feature 103 poets and translators, and 41 visual artists. Highlights include: Charles Bukowski, Robert Creeley, Diane di Palma, James Laughlin, Denise Levertov, Michael McClure, Pablo Neruda, William Carlos Williams, Ansel Adams, Michael Kenna, Dorothea Lange, Black Sparrow Press, City Lights Books, The Ecco Press, New Directions, Persea Books, and many other people and publishers. Bulk of the collection is American poets, however poets from other countries are represented.

prefercite.head: Preferred Citation
prefercite.p: [Item], Streetfare Journal poetry posters, Lilly Library, Indiana University, Bloomington, Indiana.

relatedmaterial.head: Related Materials
relatedmaterial.p: See Corman mss., Corman mss. III, and Célan, Paul mss., also located at the Lilly Library, Indiana University, Bloomington, Indiana.

did.physdesc: 11" X 28" broadsides, 2 color or 3-color printing, on card stock except where noted
